channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Boeing whistleblower alleges plane maker lost track of up to 400 faulty 737 parts
item.description: Boeing inspector Sam Mohawk alleges that as of last year, the company had lost as many as 400 faulty 737 Max aircraft parts and deleted records for many of those from an internal cataloging system.

item.title: Uber, Khosla, Nvidia invest in $200 million funding round for autonomous trucking startup Waabi
item.description: Autonomous trucking startup Waabi has raised $200 million in an oversubscribed Series B funding round led by existing investors Uber and Khosla Ventures.

item.title: Record percentage of central bankers expect gold holdings to increase
Huawei's homegrown mobile OS is proving so successful, it's reportedly thinking of charging developers for using it
item.description: Huawei's HarmonyOS is now the second-most popular mobile operating system in China, overtaking Apple's iOS.

item.title: Tuesday's analyst calls: Apple gets a price target hike, real estate stock to pop nearly 50%
item.description: A real estate data stock and a beauty company were among the companies being talked about by analysts on Tuesday.

item.title: Ocean SUV maker Fisker files for bankruptcy protection
FOMO still ‘ruling the market’ says Wharton’s Jeremy Siegel, as investors hold out for an elusive rate cut to boost prospects
item.description: Jeremy Siegel, emeritus professor at the University of Pennsylvania, wrote tech innovations like Nvidia are continuing to "capture the imagination" of the market.

item.title: EV startup Fisker files for bankruptcy, aims to sell assets
item.description: Electric vehicle maker Fisker filed for bankruptcy protection late on Monday, looking to sell its assets and restructure its debt.

item.title: The AI bubble has lifted the U.S. stock market. What happens if it bursts?
Almost 2 feet of snow are predicted for the Rockies as tens of millions of people in the U.S. swelter under extreme heat alerts
item.description: Extreme heat alerts continued for tens of millions of people in the United States on Tuesday as cities including Chicago broke records at the start of a week of sweltering weather.

item.title: 'A threat like no other': The West watches on concerned as Putin visits North Korea
item.description: The Kremlin announced only on Monday that Putin would pay "a friendly state visit" to North Korea at the invitation of North Korea's leader Kim Jong Un.

item.title: Merck’s vaccine approval poses threat to one of Pfizer’s top-selling products
OceanGate Titan imploded 1 year ago on the way to the Titanic
item.description: A year after an experimental submersible imploded en route to the Titanic, unanswered questions linger — with no immediate answers.

item.title: Boeing CEO heads to Senate hearing over safety and manufacturing crises
item.description: Boeing is under fire after a door plug blew out of one of its nearly new 737 Max planes in January during an Alaska Airlines flight.

item.title: Adobe sued by U.S. regulators for making it too hard to cancel subscriptions
